name: paste-replaced
description: Paste text replaced using regular expressions that you configure, optionally simulating that you are typing it. Works anywhere in VS Code, not just the editors. E.g. ood for fast typing canned text in your presentations and a lot of other cases.

commands.title: Copy Selected Text and Paste Replaced

paste-replaced.replacers.markdownDescription: An array of replacers. _**NB:** Only the first array will be used by the extension. Use the other ”slots” to have a way to save patterns that are not currently active._

items.markdownDescription: A replacer has a `name` and a `replacements` array. The `name` is used to identify the replacer in the UI.

name.markdownDescription: The name of the replacer. This is only used for display purposes in the UI.

replacements.markdownDescription: An array of `[search, replace, flags?]` tuples. These will be applied to the text in the order they are configured.

items.markdownDescription: A `[search, replace, flags?]` tuple where `search` is a string that compiles to a JS regex pattern, `replace` is a string that compiles to a regex replace pattern, and `flags?` is an optional string of regex flags. Only the first occurrence of `search` will be replaced by `replace`, unless the `g` flag is provided.

paste-replaced.simulateTypingSpeed.markdownDescription: Should the text be inserted simulating that it is being ”typed” in? If so, how fast should the typing be?
enumDescriptions: Don't simulate typing, just paste it all
Type the text neither fast, nor slow

scripts.vscode:prepublish: npm run clean && npm run release
